intro: Cotyledon alternans, commonly known as the "alternating cotyledon," is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, fleshy, and often colorful leaves that alternate along the stems. The plant belongs to the family Aizoaceae, also known as the ice plant family, and is known for its ability to store water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Its leaves are typically triangular or rhombic in shape and can display a variety of hues, including red, pink, and purple. Cotyledon alternans thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect sunlight to maintain its vibrant coloration.
